column4: hi.. im running windows using virtualbox in ububntu in fullscreen mode...but while logging sending ctrl-alt-del doesn't do anything to it...
any idea whats the issue...
What is your host key? (Default is Right Control button)
I get  fullscreen with no panels...how to get it back the panel
You're on your Windows guest I assume?
im running virtual machine from ubuntu...
Yes, Ubuntu is your host (The thing running virtual box), and Windows is your guest (The thing running INSIDE virtual box).
yeah..
Hit right ctrl + F, that should close fullscreen.. err exit fullscreen, rather.
Assuming you didn't change any of the default binds, that will work
Also, to fix your Ctrl + Alt + Delete problem, try using the LEFT Control button, and right Alt + Del.
thanks a lot...its working
No problem :) Further, have you installed guest additions on Windows?
no.. i havnt installed...

I recommend it, it is very useful. Care to install it now? All it basically does is add integration between the host OS and the guest OS. Such as mouse integration (The mouse and keyboard automatically are selected), Seamless mode (Ubuntu GNOME and Windows DWM are paralelled together), and other features.
how to install it ?
One sec i'll write out step by step instructions
ty

In the window holding the VM, click Devices > Install Guest Additions, It will mount a CD in Windows. If you don't have autorun on, the dialog won't pop up by default, so go to Start > (My) Computer > (Whatever CD drive) and open up the 32bit installer.
Then go through the on screen instructions, and reboot when done. They should be installed and you will see the results immediately.
thanks ..will try that...i dont have window cd right nw...
